medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced episodic or postural tachycardia, palpitations, extreme lability of arterial blood pressure when standing, frequent syncopal episodes, fatigue, neck pain, migraine-like headaches, severe light-headedness, visual impairment, and unstable gait within 2 minutes of standing. Symptoms persisted even when resuming a recumbent posture.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Orthostatic intolerance syndrome, mitral valve prolapse, Reiter syndrome, anorexia nervosa.
medical_history.social_history: The patient required salt and fluid replacement at home, drank large quantities of fluids before rising in the morning, and wore compression stockings to prevent fainting.
